page.title: 10Transport, schooling, pub
page.content: The block has one{bus service,}run by Barton's. This is the No. 12 single-decker between Nottingham and Leicester, which runs hourly during the week, two-hourly on Sundays, and serves both Widmerpool and Wysall. Both{village schools}having been closed, the children (roughly 60 in the area) must travel by bus from Wysall to East Leake, Loughborough, Nottingham, Costock or Keyworth, and from Widmerpool to Willoughby (primary) or Keyworth. The{Plough Inn}in Wysall is about 300 years old. It is very popular with outsiders but less so with village people. It could be that the strong Methodist tradition keeps many of the villagers from the pub. Also no darts, dominoes or skittles teams exist, which might attract local people. An old plough hangs on the white wall.
